headline: Is ADP’s September Payroll Miss Reshaping Investor Confidence in Its Data Amid Government Shutdown?
summary: Earlier this week, Automatic Data Processing (ADP) reported an unexpected loss of 32,000 private-sector jobs in its September payroll report, missing analyst estimates and sparking stronger expectations for Federal Reserve interest rate cuts as the ongoing U.S. government shutdown delayed official labor market data releases. With government data unavailable, ADP’s payroll report became a primary source for labor market insights, drawing heightened attention from investors, policymakers, and...
